# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # convert to lowercase 
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # replace any leading or trailing whitespaces with nothing
    col = strip(col)
    
    # replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, ' ' => "_")
    col = replace(col, '-' => "_")

    return col
end
```
This function firstly converts the input `col` to lowercase. It then strips off any leading or trailing whitespaces from this string using the `strip()` function. Finally, it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores. The cleaned column name is then returned by the function.
